ADHD.question: How often do you have difficulty sustaining your attention while doing something for work, school, a hobby, or fun activity (e.g., remaining focused during lectures, lengthy reading or conversations)?
How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
How often are you easily distracted by external stimuli, like something in your environment or unrelated thoughts?
How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
How often do you avoid, dislike, or are reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort or thought?
How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
How often do you have trouble listening to someone, even when they are speaking directly to you — like your mind is somewhere else?
When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
How often do you have difficulty in organizing an activity or task needing to get done (e.g., poor time management, fails to meet deadlines, difficulty managing sequential tasks)?
How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?

Anxiety.question: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Does worry or anxiety make it hard to concentrate?

Bipolar.question: You felt so good or hyper that other people thought you were not your normal self or were so hyper that you got into trouble?
At times I am MUCH more talkative or speak MUCH faster than usual.
You were so irritable that you shouted at people or started fights or arguments?
There have been times when I was MUCH more active or did MANY more things than usual.
You felt much more self-confident than usual?
I get into moods where I feel VERY speeded up or irritable.
You got much less sleep than usual and found you didn’t really miss it?
There have been times when I have felt both high (elated) and low (depressed) AT THE SAME TIME.
Thoughts raced through your head or you couldn’t slow your mind down?
My self-confidence ranges from GREAT self-doubt to EQUALLY GREAT overconfidence.

Depression.question: Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down ?
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed
How often have you had thoughts of harming yourself or others?
How often do you have difficulty concentrating or making decisions?
How has your school performance been affected recently?
Are you withdrawing from friends and family?

Eating disorder.question: How often you been feeling anxious or upset about your body or eating?
Have you been excessively exercising to try to lose weight or change your body?
Have you feel pressured to look a certain way or lose weight?
Have you been avoiding social events or situations that involve food?
How often you experienced any physical symptoms like dizziness or fatigue?
Do you follow obsessive rituals around food and eating, such as only drinking out of a certain cup
How often you feel guilty or ashamed after eating?
Have you been engaging in secretive behaviors related to food, like hiding food or eating alone?
Are you experiencing any physical symptoms like stomach pain, constipation, or heartburn that you think might be related to your eating habits?
Have you been isolating yourself from friends or family?

paranoia.question: How often are you ever suspicious of other people or question their motives?
How often you believe people are trying to harm or trick you, even if there’s no evidence?
How often you feel suspicious of people who have acted loyally towards you?
How often you respond with hostility or anger when you feel insulted?
I bear grudges (e.g., I don't forgive insults, injuries or slights).
I perceive attacks on my character or reputation that aren&#;t usually apparent to others, and am quick to react angrily or to counterattack
I am reluctant to confide in or open up to others because I fear the information will be maliciously used against me in the future.
I read hidden insulting or threatening meanings into innocent remarks or events.
Have you been experiencing changes in your sleep patterns, such as trouble falling asleep or frequent nightmares?
Do you feel the need to constantly check and re-check things to make sure you're safe?

PTSD.question: Have you experienced a very frightening or upsetting event recently or in the past?
Do you become distressed by sights, sounds, smells or feelings that remind you of the traumatic event?
Do you have trouble remembering an important aspect of the traumatic event?
Do you have nightmares or distressing dreams related to that event?
Are you experiencing mood changes, like feeling very irritable or angry?
Do you often feel numb or detached from your surroundings or from other people?
Are you experiencing mood changes, like feeling very irritable or angry?
Have you been having trouble sleeping or staying asleep?
Are you uninterested in activities you enjoyed before the traumatic event?
Have these issues caused significant difficulties in your school?

OCD.question: How often you ever experience unwanted repetitive and persistent thoughts that cause you anxiety?
Do you fear contamination (i.e. germs) from people or the environment and engage in excessive cleaning? If so, how often?
Do you follow excessive hand washing, showering and tooth brushing
Do you engage in rituals that provide temporary relief to your anxiety, such as counting or checking ?
Have you ever tried to hide these thoughts or behaviors from others?
How often you mentally repeat words or numbers a certain number of times, or concentrate on good or safe numbers
Do you belive in touching, tapping or moving in a particular way or a certain number of times
Needing to constantly ask questions or confess to seek reassurance
How often you feel distressed or upset by these thoughts and behaviors?
Do you recognize that these thoughts and behaviors might not make logical sense, but you still can't stop them?

psychosis.question: I speak very quickly or slowly
I Change topics frequently in conversation
Have you seen unusual things like flashes, flames, blinding light, or geometric figures?
Have you been confused at times whether something you experienced was real or imaginary?
Do you sometimes get strange feelings on or just beneath your skin, like bugs crawling?
Do you sometimes feel suddenly distracted by distant sounds that you are not normally aware of?
Do familiar surroundings sometimes seem strange, confusing, threatening or unreal to you?
Do you have difficulty getting your point across, because you ramble or go off the track a lot when you talk?
Have you had the sense that some person or force is around you, although you couldn’t see anyone?
Do you find yourself feeling mistrustful or suspicious of other people?

schizophrenia.question: How often you ever hear or see things that others cannot?
How often other people have a difficult time guessing your emotions by your facial expressions?
How often you feel that you are being tracked, followed, or watched at home or outside?
Are you struggling with maintaining social relationships and academic demands?
Do other people say that it is difficult for you to stay on subject or for them to understand you?
Do you find it difficult to organize or keep track of your thinking?
Do you feel that you have powers that other people cannot understand or appreciate?
Do you struggle to keep up with daily living tasks such as showering, changing clothes, cleaning ?
Do you get the sense that others are controlling your thoughts and emotions?

Mood disorder.question: Has there ever been a period of time when you were not your usual self and you felt so good or so hyper that other people thought you were not your normal self or you were so hyper that you got into trouble?
you were so irritable that you shouted at people or started fights or arguments?
Do you feel tired or have low energy?
Have you lost interest in activities or hobbies that used to make you happy?
Do you have trouble concentrating or paying attention in school or during other activities?
Do you have trouble falling asleep or staying asleep?
Do you have trouble concentrating or paying attention in school or during other activities?
Were you were much more active or did many more things than current?
Have you had thoughts about hurting yourself or others?
Have you been experiencing physical symptoms like headaches or stomachaches that might be related to your feelings?

substance abuse disorder.question: How often have you used alcohol or drugs in the past year?
How frequently do you use substances to cope with stress or difficult emotions?
How often have you tried to cut down or control your substance use but found it difficult?
How often have you experienced negative consequences because of your substance use?
How frequently have you lied to friends or family about your substance use?
How often do you spend a lot of time obtaining, using, or recovering from the effects of substances?
How often have you lost interest in activities or hobbies you used to enjoy because of substance use?
How often have you experienced withdrawal symptoms when you've tried to stop using substances (e.g., feeling sick, shaky, or anxious)?
How often have you engaged in risky behaviors while under the influence of substances?
How often do you spend time with peers who use substances?

specific phobia disorder.question: How often do you feel extremely scared or anxious when you encounter the thing or situation that frightens you the most?
How often have you gone out of your way to avoid the thing or situation that scares you?
How much does your fear affect your daily life, such as going to school or spending time with friends?
How often have you experienced physical symptoms when confronting your fear (e.g., racing heart, sweating, shaking)?
How often do you experience nightmares or distressing thoughts about the thing or situation that scares you?
How often do you feel a strong need to be reassured or comforted by someone when you're anxious about your fear?
Do you experience intense fear or anxiety when you think about or see images related to your phobia, even if you're not in the actual situation?
Have there been situations where your fear prevented you from doing something you wanted to do or that was expected of you?
Do you find it challenging to control your fear, even when you know it's irrational or excessive?
How often do you feel embarrassed or ashamed because of your fear?
